title: Mallory Klostermann
text:
Hello! I’m Mallory.
I am excited to announce that I’ve just started a masters in statistics at the University of Illinois in Urbana-Champaign! Here, I plan to explore the mathematics behind popular machine learning algorithms, expand my knowledge of statistical models and frameworks, gain experiences working with real-world big data, and learn how all of these topics can be tied together to answer industry’s toughest questions.
Check back for website updates in the coming weeks!
Contact: malloryklostermann@outlook.com

title: Mallory Klostermann
text:
GPA: 3.92









Worked with a team of undergraduate researchers to develop a generalized linear mixed model with AR(1) covariance structure for forecasting lightning strikes using NOAA’s meteorological data

Summarized completed research in a poster presentation for the Illinois Undergraduate Research Symposium





Conducted an exploratory factor analysis on survey results to extract features determining social justice alignment among social work program directors nationwide
Developed a Poisson rate model attempting to identify variables contributing significantly to the graduation rates of problem-solving courts in the United States





Analyze spreadsheets and data visualizations to generate reports of meteorological data from several field site eddy covariance flux towers to ensure proper data collection and equipment maintenance
Clean datasets and generate visualizations using R to locate potential errors in data collection, make corresponding corrections to the dataset, and analyze data collected by the lab Use Excel and to correctly format several years of continuously sampled data for submission to the Ameriflux database
Assist in employee training, lab maintenance, data collection, and field work at UIUC’s Energy Farm and SoyFACE facilities
















Facilitated personalized learning experiences in office hours to ensure student comprehension of general programming practices, data wrangling, and methods for generating data visualizations in R Studio
Contributed to development of meaningful student assessment methods in PrairieLearn using R and Github
Proctored exams and graded assignments with feedback necessary to promote future student success








Received training in peer supervision, leadership, and effective management in a diverse work environment
Trained a team of 20+ employees in customer service, daily protocol, emergency procedures, and work-related computer programs through several days of interactive presentations
Presented monthly meetings, coordinated scheduling, assisted in staffing, and completed managerial duties
Collaborated with a team of 13 paraprofessional staff to provide a cohesive, enriching living environment for more than 600 residents

Desk Clerk, Allen Hall Front Desk, University of Illinois Housing, March 2019 - July 2021
Intern, ToneGood Music Studio, March 2021 - August 2021
Summer Counselor, Next Generation Schools, May 2020 - August 2020
Clarinet Lesson Instructor, February 2016 - August 2020
Lifeguard and Swim Instructor, Korte Recreation Center, May 2014 - December 2018
















QuantCrit and Social Justice Research Workshop, 10 Jan 2023
Driving the Justice Agenda Forward, 2 Feb 2023








Assisted high school student in finding deeper conceptual understanding of course material in AP Statistics
Instilled learning strategies and study habits to promote improved performance across applications







R, SAS, SQL, Python, statistical modeling and computing, machine learning algorithms, version control (Git), Jupyter notebooks
Problem solving, teaching, leadership, critical thinking, communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
